channel.title: Fixing an AV cable
channel.description:
Yeah i bought a nintendo 64 a few months ago and like 2 weeks later the AV cable dies. I CBF to order a new one off ebay, so is there anyway i can fix my current one?
Ps: Its just the sound part thats dead.

item.title: Fixing an AV cable
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“bootnecklad, post:3, topic:288090”]Instead of splicing the broken part just take some wire around the same gauge and completely replace the wire, you’ll need a couple of peices of heat shrink to keep it together. As R.I.P RSC said it’s probably close to one of the ends so strip back as far as possibly the cables and solder on some new stuff, heatshrink and done! almost new cable.

<3 N64[/quote]This. The same thing happened to me, but for all 3 (my dog chewed on it), and for the controller (same reason…RAGE). I solved it the same way bootnecklad would. You can get the supplies you need for under 5 dollars. And if you haven’t done anything like it before, its kind of cool and educational.

Read full topic

item.title: Fixing an AV cable
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

Instead of splicing the broken part just take some wire around the same gauge and completely replace the wire, you’ll need a couple of peices of heat shrink to keep it together. As R.I.P RSC said it’s probably close to one of the ends so strip back as far as possibly the cables and solder on some new stuff, heatshrink and done! almost new cable.

<3 N64

Read full topic

item.title: Fixing an AV cable
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Cut the part that’s broken out of it and put it back together. It’s probably close to one of the ends.

Read full topic
